alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 5:52PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Brown, southwestern Kewaunee, Calumet, Winnebago, Waushara, southwestern Waupaca, southern Outagamie and Manitowoc Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 550 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Appleton to near Lake Poygan to 8 miles west of Wautoma. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Localized flooding. Locations impacted include... Appleton, Oshkosh, Manitowoc, Wautoma, Menasha, Kaukauna, Little Chute, Kimberly, Chilton and Brillion. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Calumet; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago
